title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
NATO estimated Russia has lost as much as one-fifth of its combat forces sent to Ukraine in about a month of fighting, as Biden and alliance leaders gathered in Brussels to discuss providing further support to Kyiv to repel the Russian invasion.

---

Republicans aggressively questioned Supreme Court nominee Jackson over her sentences for convicted criminals, while Senate Democrats decried GOP tactics they said were disrespectful.

---

Moderna's Covid-19 vaccine safely induced robust immune responses in children ages 6 months to 5 years in a new study, the company said, though the shot had modest efficacy against Omicron.

---

Trump rescinded an endorsement for Alabama Senate candidate Mo Brooks, saying the congressman had moved on from pushing claims about a stolen 2020 presidential election.

---

An ex-Manhattan prosecutor who investigated Trump said in a resignation letter last month that he believed the former president committed numerous felonies.

---

Idaho's governor signed into law new abortion limits modeled on a Texas law, even as he expressed reservations about the legislation.

---

Rescuers recovered one of the black boxes from the Boeing 737 that crashed in southern China.

---

The Taliban halted a plan to reopen secondary schools for girls, reneging on an earlier pledge.
